page.title: 15LANGFORD BUDVILLE COMMON
page.content: The Common is about 180 square acres and is known as Langton Heathfield. The Somerset Trust for Nature Conservation own and look after this area including all wild life. The deciduous trees that grow there are the ash, oak, silver birch and beech, there are a few evergreen trees such as the scots pine. Many different animals live there, deer, snakes, squirrels, foxes, mice, rabbits, many birds along with an abundance of insects such as beetles and butterflies. Every now and again the Trust cut down all the braken and ferns to allow new strong growth the following season. Next to the road on an area of grass there is a seat called the Jubilee seat. At the bottom of the Common there used to be a barn ,now in ruins, which was once the home of a barn owl.
